      • main

      • homePage

        @GetMapping("/twittertrends/home")
public java.lang.String homePage​(org.springframework.ui.Model model)
        Returns the home page of the application, populating the table with the unfiltered trends of the current day
        Parameters:
        model - the model of the home page (auto handled by Thymeleaf)
        Returns:
        the home page

      • homePage

        @GetMapping(value="/twittertrends/home",
            params={"date","filter"})
public java.lang.String homePage​(org.springframework.ui.Model model,
                                 @RequestParam("date")
                                 java.lang.String date,
                                 @RequestParam("filter")
                                 java.lang.String expression)
        Returns the home page of the application, with the table of trends filtered by an expression and a date
        Parameters:
        model - the model of the home page (auto handled by Thymeleaf)
        date - the date of the desired trends. If it's empty, the returned trends will be of the current day
        expression - the filter expression. If it's empty, the returned trends will be unfiltered
        Returns:
        the home page

      • getTrendList

        @GetMapping("/twittertrends/api/trends")
@ResponseBody
public static java.lang.Object getTrendList()
        Returns the unfiltered trends of the current day, in the HTTP body as JSON format. In case of error an HashMap with the error message in the field "errorMsg" is returned
        Returns:
        response body

      • getMetadata

        @GetMapping("/twittertrends/api/metadata")
@ResponseBody
public static java.lang.Object getMetadata()
        Returns the metadata of the Trend class
        Returns:
        response body with metadata

      • getFilteredTrends

        @GetMapping(value="/twittertrends/api/trends",
            params={"date","filter"})
@ResponseBody
public static java.lang.Object getFilteredTrends​(@RequestParam("date")
                                                 java.lang.String date,
                                                 @RequestParam("filter")
                                                 java.lang.String expression)
        Returns the filtered trends of the selected day, in the HTTP body as JSON format. In case of error an HashMap with the error message in the field "errorMsg" is returned
        Parameters:
        date - the date of the desired trends. If it's empty, the returned trends will be of the current day
        expression - the filter expression. If it's empty, the returned trends will be unfiltered
        Returns:
        response body
